title: BP Needs to Replace Lost Russian Assets
sub_head: Oil-and-gas giant is trying to maintain a steady course but it won’t be easy
body:
BP shareholders seem to be confident that the loss of its big Russian assets won’t knock the company off its stride. That leaves the transitioning oil-and-gas giant with a lot of work to do.
The company outlined stellar first-quarter results Tuesday, boosted by “exceptional” oil-and-gas trading, strong refining margins and high commodity prices. The results were marred only by one not-so-small matter: the $25.5 billion pre-announced write off of its stake in Russian oil giant Rosneft and other assets in the country.
